name: 2-amino-5-chloro-3-fluoropyridine
Reason: 2-amino-5-chloro-3-fluoropyridine is a compound with several functional groups that can influence its melting point. The basic unit for comparison can be pyridine, which has a melting point of -41.6°C. The introduction of the amino group (–NH2) will increase the melting point due to the hydrogen bonding capability of the amino group. The chlorine atom (–Cl) will also increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals forces. The fluorine atom (–F) will also increase the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and van der Waals forces, but the electronegativity of fluorine may slightly lower the melting point due to the electron-withdrawing effect. The net effect of these functional groups is an increase in the melting point compared to pyridine.
